metadata.subject: Jane Doe No. 1 and Jane Doe No. 2's Response in Opposition to Motion for Leave to File Supplement to Reply in Support of Motion for Limited Intervention by Alan M. Dershowitz

organizations: U.S. House Committee on Oversight and Accountability
United States District Court Southern District of Florida
Farmer, Jaffe, Weissing, Edwards, Fistos & Lehrman, P.L.
S.J. Quinney College of Law at the University of Utah

relationships.description: Dershowitz accused of sexually molesting Jane Doe No. 3, who alleges he was involved in Epstein's trafficking scheme
Dershowitz visited Epstein's properties including Little Saint James Island and New Mexico ranch
Co-counsel representing victims in CVRA case against Epstein and associates
Dershowitz sued Edwards for defamation in separate state court action

assets: Jeffrey Epstein's Ranch in New Mexico

analysis.purpose: To oppose Alan Dershowitz's motion to intervene in the CVRA case and challenge his credibility regarding sexual abuse allegations
analysis.significance: Legal filing in high-profile case involving Jeffrey Epstein's sex trafficking network and allegations against powerful figures including Alan Dershowitz and Prince Andrew

notable_quotes: Dershowitz has repeatedly claimed in the media that he has irrefutable proof that her allegations are false... yet has yet to produce a single document to this Court
Dershowitz can't have it both ways – simultaneously claiming he has the records and that he is harmed in collecting them
The Court should draw the obvious inference that Dershowitz, despite making broad claims to the media, has no such evidence to produce – because Jane Doe No. 3's allegations are true
red_flags: Inconsistency between public claims of evidence and failure to produce in court

blackmail_indicators.description: No evidence of blackmail or coercion found in this document - it is a legal filing about discovery disputes and allegations

illegal_activity.description: This document discusses allegations of illegal activity (sexual abuse) but is itself a legal filing, not evidence of first-hand illegal activity by the sender

details: References to media appearances by Dershowitz on Fox Business, CNN, NBC Today Show

public_knowledge.context: This document is part of the public Jeffrey Epstein case files involving high-profile figures. The allegations against Alan Dershowitz received significant media coverage in 2014-2015

analysis.summary: Legal filing opposing Alan Dershowitz's motion to intervene in Jeffrey Epstein victims' case, arguing Dershowitz has failed to produce promised evidence disproving sexual abuse allegations despite making extensive media claims, and highlighting discovery non-compliance in parallel defamation case.
